Common questions about our plate and tub: Common questions about our plate and tube integrated laser cutting machines
The exchange platform uses an automated: The exchange platform uses an automated quick-change system with precision positioning. Simply select the desired mode (plate or tube) on the control panel, and the machine automatically releases the current platform and guides the operator to install the correct one. Built-in sensors verify proper alignment and installation before allowing cutting operations to begin. The entire process takes approximately 10 seconds.
Yes, cutting quality is identical in bot: Yes, cutting quality is identical in both modes. The machine uses the same fiber laser source, cutting head, and control system for both applications. The CNC system automatically optimizes parameters for each mode. Positioning accuracy remains High precision for both plate and tube cutting, ensuring consistent precision across all operations.
The integrated machine typically costs 3: The integrated machine typically costs 30-40% less than purchasing separate plate and tube cutting machines. Additional savings include: reduced maintenance costs (one laser source instead of two), lower utility expenses, reduced floor space requirements (saving rental costs), and simplified operator training. Most customers see ROI within 18-24 months compared to buying two separate systems.
Absolutely! The quick exchange platform: Absolutely! The quick exchange platform makes it practical to switch between modes multiple times per day. Many customers batch similar cuts together to minimize platform changes, but the flexibility allows you to switch modes as needed. The 10-second exchange time means you can efficiently handle mixed production orders without significant downtime.
The integrated machine requires approxim: The integrated machine requires approximately 50% less floor space than separate plate and tube machines. Standard configuration needs about 8m x 4m including operator access areas. This compact footprint makes it ideal for workshops with limited space. Additional area is needed for auxiliary equipment like chillers and dust extractors, which are shared between both modes.
Training is actually simplified because: Training is actually simplified because operators learn one control system for both functions. The interface is intuitive with clear mode selection and automatic parameter switching. Most operators become proficient in both modes within 3-5 days of training. The unified control system means operators don't need to learn two different machines, reducing the overall training burden.
